titlestmt.subtitle: A Guide to his Papers at the Indiana University Archives
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Walker Byer.

note.p: © 2017 Trustees of Indiana University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-02-04 05:09:56 -0500.

did.abstract: W. Edson Richmond was a professor in both English and Folklore, and Acting Director of the Folklore Institute (1981-1982) at Indiana University, Bloomington, from 1945 until 1986. This collection documents Richmond's research and publishing in the area of Norwegian and Scandinavian language and culture as well as other academic activities, such as instruction and academic advising, service on departmental and professional committees, and participation in folklore conferences and professional societies. Types of material present in the collection include published and unpublished articles, research and instruction notes, correspondence, and programs and brochures.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: I.U. Ph.D. Examination Committee file closed to researchers.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: W. Edson Richmond (1916-1994) was a professor at Indiana University Bloomington from 1945-1986. He served as acting chair of IU's Folklore Institute, as editor of the Journal of Folklore Research, and was involved in a multitude of organizations such as the Modern Language Association, the Hoosier Folklore Society, and the Fellows of the American Folklore Society. Additionally, Richmond served as the chair for Indiana University's Fulbright Committee. As his papers will show, the scope of W. Edson Richmond's research pertains to Norwegian language and culture.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into five series: Biographical, Research, Publications, Committees, and Conferences and Events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The W. Edson Richmond papers span the years 1855-1990 and mainly document Richmond's career as a folklorist and professor of the IU Folklore Institute at Indiana University Bloomington (1945-1986). Professional activities represented in the collection include Richmond's research and publishing on Scandinavian (especially Norwegian) language and culture, instruction and academic advising, service on departmental and professional committees, and participation in folklore conferences and professional societies. Additionally, the collection includes material on Richmond's personal education background and family history. Types of material present in the collection include published and unpublished articles, research and instruction notes, correspondence, and programs and brochures.
The collection is organized into five series: Biographical, Research, Publications, Committees, and Conferences and Events.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional publications and research materials may be accessed in IUScholarworks.
Related photographs may be available in the Indiana University Archives Photograph Collection.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: The donor(s) of this collection have not transferred their copyrights for the materials to the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], W. Edson Richmond papers, Collection C665, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Transferred from the Indiana University Department of Folklore and Ethnomusicology, April 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Biographical series includes material related to Richmond's family and education background as well as his career as a professor at Indiana University. It is organized into two subseries: Life and education (1855-1976) and Professional (1939-1993, undated). The Life and education subseries contains materials related to Richmond's educational background such as course notes and diplomas, as well as genealogical research about his family that include newspaper clippings and photos. The Professional subseries documents Richmond's career at Indiana University and includes materials for courses he taught, faculty reports, salary and sabbatical information, materials for Ph.D. exams and announcements, and Richmond's communications.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged in roughly chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Akron High School Diploma (1935) tucked into diploma

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Professional subseries documents Richmond's career at Indiana University and includes materials for courses he taught, faculty reports, salary and sabbatical information, materials for Ph.D. exams and announcements, and Richmond's communications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Research series contains materials that relate to Richmond's studies in ballads and proverbs. Also included are the writings and notes of other researchers and students that cover the same subjects as Richmond's folklore research.

did.unittitle: Breakdown & Rejuvenation of the Folksong-Making Tradition in Pittsburgh Since the Civil War

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Contains photo of W.E. Richmond, and various newspaper clippings

did.unittitle: Norske Folkevisor: notes for editions of folksongs not found in Liestøl and Moe's popular edition
Scandinavian Elements in the English and Scottish Popular Ballads
The Child ballads in the Journal of American Folklore
Ballad Scholarship in the Journal of American Folklore
American Lithuanian Folk Ballads and Songs
Jørgen Moe og hans arbeid med norske folkeminne

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Publications series is arranged into two subseries: General (1944-1994) and Ütsyn (undated). The General subseries contain Richmond's published works, including his dissertation. The Ütsyn subseries is a large collection of both published and unpublished articles for a publication by Liestøl and Moe, editors of Norske Folkeviser.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged in roughly chronological order.

did.unittitle: Dissertation-Place Names in the English and Scottish Popular Ballads and Their American Variants
Scandinavian and English Language Ballads as a Distinct Genre

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged by article number. Article numbering has been retained from Richmond's original file organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Committees series documents Richmond's participation in Indiana University departmental committees as well as external organizations such as the American Folklore Society.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by organization name.

did.unittitle: Fellows of the American Folklore Society

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Conferences and Events series (1950-1993) is further organized into two subseries, General (1950-1986) and Conference Brochures and Programs (1950-1993). The General subseries contains materials related to the planning and execution of folklore conferences that Richmond attended over the years. The Conference and Brochures subseries contains the literature from these conferences.

did.unittitle: International Conference on Nordic & Anglo-American Ballad Research

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged alphabetically by event, and the items within each event are arranged chronologically.
